page.title: 14MENTAL HEALTH CARE IN JERSEY
page.content:
On 1st January 1972 a new Jersey Mental Law was introduced to replace the 1890 law. This states:- 1) Care without compulsion wherever possible with informal voluntary admissions. 2) Compulsory admission to be in the least restrictive cicumstances. 3) Compulsory admission to hospital to be decided on medical and not legal grounds. 4)Safeguards for compulsorily detained patients including rights of appeal.
Jersey now has provision for 312 people suffering from either Mental Illness or Mental Handicap and it has moved a long way from the days of the Lunatic Asylum although the buildings are still the same ones used in the 19th century.
